items.sentence: When Tom was a kid, his family was very poor.
When was the last time that you played chess?
When was the last time you dreamed about Tom?
Tom can\'t believe Mary really believes that.
Tom can\'t refuse his grandchildren anything.
Tom can\'t understand why Mary is mad at him.
Do you still want to go to the zoo on Monday?
Do you think I had something to do with that?
Do you think Tom is still worried about that?
Do you think Tom will actually dance tonight?
Do you think Tom will be here this afternoon?
Do you think Tom would allow Mary to do that?
Come on. There\'s someone I want you to meet.
Tom lives near the beach, but he can\'t swim.
Tom lives near the ocean, but he can\'t swim.
Why don\'t you ever do what I tell you to do?
Why isn\'t there any food in my refrigerator?
Why would Tom do that if he doesn\'t have to?
Without his glasses, Tom can\'t see anything.
I don\'t want Tom to think anything\'s wrong.
